xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Extensive math library.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:author: Daniel Turcanu, Dan Muresan

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Returns the hyperbolic cosine of x.
If the result it too large, INF is returned.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $arg must be smaller than 7.104760e+002

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:cosh
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function math:cosh($arg as double) as double external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Inverse hyperbolic cosine.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $arg the arg

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:acosh
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function math:acosh($arg as double) as double external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Function performing the modulo operation between the two arguments.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $x the x
$y the y

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:fmod
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function math:fmod($x as double, $y as double) as double external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Returns the argument split as mantissa and exponent.
The recombining formula is (mantissa * 2^exponent).
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $arg the double to be split.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: A sequence of two doubles (mantissa, exponent)

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:frexp
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function math:frexp($arg as double) as double+ external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Computes a real number from the mantissa and exponent.
The formula is (x * 2^i).
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $x the mantissa
$i the exponent

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:ldexp
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function math:ldexp($x as double, $i as integer) as double external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Splits a floating-point value into fractional and integer parts.
Both the fraction and integer keep the original sign of the value.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $arg the double to be split.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: A sequence of two doubles (fraction, integer)

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:modf
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function math:modf($arg as double) as double+ external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Calculate the hyperbolic sine.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $arg the arg

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:sinh
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function math:sinh($arg as double) as double external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Calculate the inverse hyperbolic sine.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $arg the arg

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:asinh
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function math:asinh($arg as double) as double external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Calculate the hyperbolic tangent.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $arg the arg

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:tanh
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function math:tanh($arg as double) as double external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Calculate the hyperbolic tangent.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $arg must be in range -1 ... +1 (exclusive)

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:atanh
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function math:atanh($arg as double) as double external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Convert angle from degrees to radians.
The parameter is first converted to value range of (-360, 360).
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $deg angle in degrees

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:deg-to-rad
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function math:deg-to-rad($deg as double) as double

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Convert angle from radians to degrees.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $rad value in radians

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:rad-to-deg
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function math:rad-to-deg($rad as double) as double

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Checks if the double value is positive or negative infinite.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $arg the double to be checked
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: boolean true if argument is pos INF or neg INF

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:is_inf
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function math:is_inf($arg as double) as boolean external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Checks if the double value is Not a Number (NaN).
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $arg the arg
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: boolean true if the double is NaN

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:is_nan
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function math:is_nan($arg as double) as boolean external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Checks if the anyAtomicType argument is actually a numeric type or can be converted to numeric.
Borrowed from excel module.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $value Parameter to be checked.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: true if the value can be casted to numeric.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:is-a-number
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function math:is-a-number($value as anyAtomicType) as boolean

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Cast the anyAtomicType to a numeric type.
If the value is already of a numeric type then nothing is changed. Otherwise the value is casted to the numeric type that is most appropriate.
Borrowed from excel module.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $number The parameter can be a number, string, boolean value.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: math:VALUE_NOT_NUMERIC if the value cannot be casted to numeric type.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:cast-as-numeric
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function math:cast-as-numeric($number as anyAtomicType) as anyAtomicType

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Returns number rounded up, away from zero, to the nearest multiple of significance.
Significance must have the same sign as number. Number and significance must be of a numeric type or castable to numeric. Significance must not be zero.
Borrowed from excel module.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $number The value you want to round.
$significance The multiple to which you want to round.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: math:INVALID_ARGUMENT if significance is zero or it doesn't have the same sign as number.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:ceiling
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function math:ceiling($number as double, $significance as double) as double

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Returns number rounded up to the nearest even integer.
Regardless of the sign of number, a value is rounded up when adjusted away from zero.
Borrowed from excel module.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $number The value to round.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: The rounded value casted as numeric type.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:even
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function math:even($number as double) as integer

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Function for computing factorial.
This recursive function computes: number * fact(number-1)
Borrowed from excel module.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $intnum A positive integer.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:fact-integer
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare %private function math:fact-integer($intnum as integer) as integer

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Returns the factorial of a number.
Borrowed from excel module.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $number The non-negative number you want the factorial of.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: Returns the factorial of a number. The factorial of a number is equal to 1*2*3*...* number.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: math:INVALID_ARGUMENT if the number is smaller than zero

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:fact
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function math:fact($number as integer) as integer

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Rounds number down, toward zero, to the nearest multiple of significance.
Significance must have the same sign as number. Borrowed from excel module.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $number The value you want to round.
$significance The multiple to which you want to round.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: The rounded value as numeric type.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: math:INVALID_ARGUMENT if significance is zero or it doesn't have the same sign as number.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:floor
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function math:floor($number as double, $significance as double) as double

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Rounds a number down to the nearest integer.
Positive numbers are rounded toward zero, negative numbers are rounded away from zero.
Borrowed from excel module.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $number The value to be rounded.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:int
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function math:int($number as double) as integer

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Returns the remainder after number is divided by divisor.
The result has the same sign as divisor.
Borrowed from excel module.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $number The number for which you want to find the remainder.
$divisor The number by which you want to divide number. This cannot be zero.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: The remainder from division as numeric type.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: math:DIVIDE_BY_0 if divisor is zero after casting to numeric.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:mod
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function math:mod($number as double, $divisor as double) as double

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Returns number rounded up to the nearest odd integer, away from zero.
Borrowed from excel module.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $number The value to round.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:odd
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function math:odd($number as double) as integer

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Function for product.
Multiplies all numbers in the sequence.
Borrowed from excel module.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $numbers The list of arguments to be casted to numeric and multiplied.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: The multiplication result as numeric type.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:product-internal
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare %private function math:product-internal($numbers as double*) as double

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Multiplies all the numbers given as arguments and returns the product.
Borrowed from excel module.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $numbers The sequence of arguments convertible to numeric types. The sequence can be of any length.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: The multiplication result as numeric type.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:product
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function math:product($numbers as double*) as double

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Returns the integer portion of a division.
Borrowed from excel module.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $numerator The divider.
$denominator The divisor. It cannot be zero.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: The result value as numeric type.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: math:DIVIDE_BY_0 if denominator casted as numeric type has value zero.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:quotient
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function math:quotient($numerator as double, $denominator as double) as integer

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Rounds a number to a specified number of digits.
If precision is greater than 0 (zero), then number is rounded to the specified number of decimal places. If num_digits is 0, then number is rounded to the nearest integer. If num_digits is less than 0, then number is rounded to the left of the decimal point. The 0.5 is rounded away from zero.
Borrowed from excel module.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $number The number to round.
$precision The number of decimal places to keep.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: The rounded number as numeric type.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:round
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function math:round($number as double, $precision as integer) as double

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Rounds a number down, toward zero.
If num_digits is greater than 0 (zero), then number is rounded down to the specified number of decimal places. If num_digits is 0, then number is rounded down to the nearest integer. If num_digits is less than 0, then number is rounded down to the left of the decimal point.
Borrowed from excel module.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $number The number to round
$precision The number of decimal places to keep.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: the truncated number toward zero, as numeric type.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:rounddown
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function math:rounddown($number as double, $precision as integer) as double

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Rounds a number up, away from 0 (zero).
If num_digits is greater than 0 (zero), then number is rounded down to the specified number of decimal places. If num_digits is 0, then number is rounded down to the nearest integer. If num_digits is less than 0, then number is rounded down to the left of the decimal point.
Borrowed from excel module.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $number The number to round
$precision The number of decimal places to keep.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: The truncated number away from zero, as numeric type.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:roundup
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function math:roundup($number as double, $precision as integer) as double

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Determines the sign of a number.
Returns 1 if the number is positive, zero (0) if the number is 0, and -1 if the number is negative.
Borrowed from excel module.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $number The argument

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:sign
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function math:sign($number as double) as integer

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Truncates a number to an integer by removing the fractional part of the number.
Borrowed from excel module.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $number The argument .

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:trunc
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function math:trunc($number as double) as integer

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Truncates a number down to precision.
This behaves exactly like rounddown.
Borrowed from excel module.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $number The argument castable to numeric type.
$precision The number of decimal places to keep .

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:trunc
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function math:trunc($number as double, $precision as integer) as double

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Sorts a sequence of numbers or arguments castable to numeric.
It first casts all arguments to numeric and then sorts ascending.
Helper function.
Borrowed from excel module.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $numbers The sequence of arguments castable to numeric.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: The sorted sequence as numeric types.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:sort-numbers
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function math:sort-numbers($numbers as double*) as double*

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Returns the double factorial of a number.
Computes the double factorial of n as n(n-2)(n-4)...
Borrowed from excel module.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $number The positive integer value.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: math:INVALID_ARGUMENT if the number is negative.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:factdouble
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function math:factdouble($number as integer) as integer

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Function for computing GCD.
It calculates the minimum value from a sequence of positive integers, not taking into account the zero value.
Borrowed from excel module.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $numbers The sequence of positive integers.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: The minimum value. If the sequence contains only zero values, then zero is returned.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:min-without-zero
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare %private function math:min-without-zero($numbers as integer+) as integer

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Function for computing GCD.
Checks if all integer numbers from a sequence divide exactly to a divider.
Borrowed from excel module.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $numbers The positive integers.
$divider The divider to be tried.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: true if the numbers divide exactly.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:try-exact-divide
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare %private function math:try-exact-divide($numbers as integer*, $divider as integer) as boolean

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Function for computing GCD.
This function iterates through possible divisors and checks if the sequence divides exactly to any of those. It starts from the minimum value from the sequence and searches downwards.
Borrowed from excel module.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $numbers The sequence of positive integers.
$min-nonzero The minimum value of numbers sequence, excluding the zero value.
$iteration Which iteration is it. It starts from 1 and continues to min-nonzero/2.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: The greatest common divisor if found, or 1 if not found.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:iterate-all-gcd
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare %private function math:iterate-all-gcd($numbers as integer*, $min-nonzero as integer, $iteration as integer) as integer

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Returns the greatest common divisor GCD of a sequence of integers.
The sequence can have one or more positive integers.
Borrowed from excel module.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $numbers The sequence of positive integers.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: math:INVALID_ARGUMENT if any number is smaller than zero.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:gcd
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function math:gcd($numbers as integer+) as integer

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Returns the least common multiple of integers.
LCM for two numbers is computed by multiplying them and dividing with GCD. The function is applied recursively replacing the first two numbers in the sequence with their LCM.
Borrowed from excel module.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $numbers The sequence of one or more positive integers.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: math:INVALID_ARGUMENT if any number is smaller than zero.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:lcm
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function math:lcm($numbers as integer+) as integer

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Returns a number rounded to the desired multiple.
MROUND rounds up, away from zero, if the remainder of dividing number by multiple is greater than or equal to half the value of multiple. MROUND is computed through math:floor function.
Borrowed from excel module.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $number The value to round,
$multiple The multiple to which you want to round number.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: The rounded number up to the desired multiple.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:mround
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function math:mround($number as decimal, $multiple as double) as double

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Converts an Arabic numeral to roman, as text.
Only the classic format is supported (out of all formats Excel requires). M is the largest digit, it represents 1000. Numbers bigger than 2000 will be represented by a sequence of "M". D = 500, C = 100, L = 50, X = 10, V = 5, I = 1.
Borrowed from excel module.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $number A positive integer.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: math:INVALID_ARGUMENT if the input integer is negative

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:roman
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function math:roman($number as integer) as string

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Multiplies the elements on the same position in each sequence and sums up the results.
Borrowed from excel module.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $array1 the sequences of numbers
$array2 the sequences of numbers

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:sumproduct
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function math:sumproduct($array1 as double*, $array2 as double*) as double

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Returns the sum of the squares of the arguments.
It uses the sumproduct function.
Borrowed from excel module.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $numbers the sequence of one or more numbers
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: the sum of squared values, as numeric type

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:sumsq
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function math:sumsq($numbers as double+) as double

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Returns the median of the given numbers.
The median is the number in the middle of a set of numbers. Half the numbers have values that are greater than the median, and half the numbers have values that are less than the median.
Borrowed from excel module.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $numbers the sequence of numbers, of any length
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: for odd count of numbers return the number in the middle of the sorted sequence. For even count of numbers return the average of the two numbers in the middle.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:median
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function math:median($numbers as double*) as double

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Returns the most frequently occurring, or repetitive, value in a sequence.
Borrowed from excel module.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $numbers the sequence of numbers, of any length
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: math:INVALID_INPUT if there are no duplicate numbers

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:mode
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function math:mode($numbers as double*) as double

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Returns the k-th percentile of values in a sequence.
If k is not a multiple of 1/(n - 1), PERCENTILE interpolates to determine the value at the k-th percentile. The function is computed by (max-min)*k + min
Borrowed from excel module.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $numbers the sequence of numbers, of any length
$k_at the percentile, with value between 0 .. 1 inclusive
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: math:INVALID_ARGUMENT if percentile is not between 0 .. 1

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:percentile
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function math:percentile($numbers as double*, $k_at as double) as double

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Function for AVEDEV.
Computes formula sum(abs(x - average)) for every x in $numbers
Borrowed from excel module.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $numbers The sequence of numbers. Sequence can be of any length.
$average The average of all numbers, computed with function AVERAGE.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:sum-deviations
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare %private function math:sum-deviations($numbers as double*, $average as double) as double

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Returns the average of the absolute deviations of data points from their mean.
The formula is sum(abs(x - average_x))/n, where n is the count of x in the sequence.
Borrowed from excel module.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $numbers the sequence of numbers. Sequence can be of any length from 1 up.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:avedev
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function math:avedev($numbers as double+) as double

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Returns the k-th largest value in a data set.
If n is the number of data points in a range, then LARGE(array,1) returns the largest value, and LARGE(array,n) returns the smallest value.
Borrowed from excel module.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $numbers the sequence of numbers The sequence can be of any length, from 1 up.
$k the position of largest value, with value from 1 to count of values
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: The k-th largest value as numeric type
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: math:INVALID_ARGUMENT if the sequence is empty or k is not a value between 1 and the size of the sequence

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:large
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function math:large($numbers as double+, $k as integer) as double

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Returns the rank of a number in a list of numbers.
The rank of a number is its size relative to other values in a list. (If you were to sort the list, the rank of the number would be its position.) RANK gives duplicate numbers the same rank.
Borrowed from excel module.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $x The number whose rank you want to find.
$numbers The sequence of numbers. The sequence can be of any length.
$order_ascending A boolean having the meaning: falsethen rank the number as if the sequence was sorted in descending order. true then rank the number as if the sequence was sorted in ascending order.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:rank
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function math:rank($x as double, $numbers as double*, $order_ascending as boolean) as double

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
This RANK function is same as the above, only that $order_ascending is set by default to false.
Borrowed from excel module.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $x The number whose rank you want to find.
$numbers the sequence of numbers. The sequence can be of any length.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:rank
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function math:rank($x as double, $numbers as double*) as double

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Returns the rank of a value in a data set as a percentage of the data set.
If x does not match one of the values in array, PERCENTRANK interpolates to return the correct percentage rank.
The formula is uses: (RANK - 1) / (size - 1) .
Borrowed from excel module.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $numbers the sequence of numbers. The sequence can be of any length, from 1 up.
$x is the value for which you want to know the rank
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: math:INVALID_ARGUMENT if the sequence is zero length

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:percentrank
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function math:percentrank($numbers as double*, $x as double) as double

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Returns the quartile of a data set.
Borrowed from excel module.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $numbers sequence of numbers. The sequence can be of any length, from 1 up.

$quart one of the values 0, 1, 2, 3, 4 with meaning: 0 compute minimum value 1 compute first quartile (25th percentile) 2 compute median value (50th percentile) 3 compute third quartile (75th percentile) 4 compute maximum value
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: the computed quartile, as numeric type
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: math:INVALID_ARGUMENT if the sequence is zero length or $quart is not one of the values 0,1,3,4

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:quartile
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function math:quartile($numbers as double*, $quart as integer) as double

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
This function computes the k-th smallest value in a data set.
Use this function to return values with a particular relative standing in a data set. If n is the number of data points in array, SMALL(array,1) equals the smallest value, and SMALL(array,n) equals the largest value. Borrowed from excel module.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $numbers A sequence of numbers. The sequence can be of any length, from 1 up.
$k The position (from the smallest) in the sequence of data to return. Must have value between 1 and size of sequence.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: math:INVALID_ARGUMENT if the sequence is zero length or $k is not a value between 1 and the size of sequence.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:small
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function math:small($numbers as double*, $k as integer) as double

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Function for VAR, VARA, VARP, VARPA and SLOPE.
It computes formula sum((x - average_x)^2) for all x in $numbers.
Borrowed from excel module.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $numbers the sequence of numbers. The sequence can be of any length.
$average The precomputed average over the sequence.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:sumsq-deviations
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare %private function math:sumsq-deviations($numbers as double*, $average as double) as double

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Estimates variance based on a sample.
The formula is sum(x - average_x)^2 / (n - 1). average_x is computed with AVERAGE function. n is the count of numbers from the sequence, excluding empty values.
Borrowed from excel module.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $numbers the sequence of numbers. The sequence can be of any length, from 1 up.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:var
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function math:var($numbers as double+) as double

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Estimates variance based on a sample.
The formula is sum(x - average_x)^2 / (n - 1). average_x is computed with AVERAGE function. n is the size of sequence, including empty values.
Borrowed from excel module.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $numbers the sequence of numbers. The sequence can be of any length, from 1 up.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:vara
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function math:vara($numbers as double+) as double

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Calculates variance based on the entire population.
The formula is sum(x - average_x)^2 / n. average_x is computed with AVERAGE function. n is the count of numbers from the sequence, excluding empty values.
Borrowed from excel module.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $numbers the sequence of numbers. The sequence can be of any length, from 1 up.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:varp
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function math:varp($numbers as double+) as double

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Calculates variance based on the entire population.
The formula is sum(x - average_x)^2 / n. average_x is computed with AVERAGE function. n is the size of sequence, including empty values.
Borrowed from excel module.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $numbers the sequence of numbers. The sequence can be of any length, from 1 up.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:varpa
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function math:varpa($numbers as double+) as double

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Function for PROB function.
Computes the sum over a sequence of numbers. Checks if the values are between 0 and 1.
Borrowed from excel module.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $prob_range The sequence of probabilities.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: The sum of probabilities. This should be 1.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: math:INVALID_ARGUMENT if any probability is not between 0 and 1.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:sum-prob
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare %private function math:sum-prob($prob_range as double*) as double

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Function for PROB function.
Checks the prob range and x range if they have the same number of values. Adds all probabilities corresponding to values between range_lower_limit and upper_limit.
Borrowed from excel module.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $x_range The sequence of x values.
$prob_range The sequence of probabilities associated to x values.
$range_lower_limit The lower limit of the range to compute the probability.
$upper_limit The upper limit of the range to compute the probability.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: $math:INVALID_ARGUMENT if x_range and prob_range do not have the same number of values.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:sum-prob-x
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare %private function math:sum-prob-x($x_range as double*, $prob_range as double*, $range_lower_limit as double, $upper_limit as double) as double

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Returns the probability that values in a range are between two limits.
Borrowed from excel module.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $x_range is the range of numeric values of x with which there are associated probabilities. This does not need to be ordered.
$prob_range is a set of probabilities associated with values in x_range.
$range_lower_limit is the lower bound on the value for which you want a probability.
$upper_limit is the upper bound on the value for which you want a probability.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: The probability of the entire range
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: math:INVALID_ARGUMENT if any probability is not between 0 and 1
math:INVALID_ARGUMENT if the sum of probabilities is not equal to 1
math:INVALID_ARGUMENT if x_range and prob_range do not have the same number of values

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:prob
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function math:prob($x_range as double+, $prob_range as double+, $range_lower_limit as double, $upper_limit as double) as double

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
This is the same as math:prob#4, only that upper_limit is not specified.
The probability is computed only for range_lower_limit.
Borrowed from excel module.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $x_range is the range of numeric values of x with which there are associated probabilities. This does not need to be ordered.
$prob_range is a set of probabilities associated with values in x_range.
$range_lower_limit is the value for which you want a probability.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: The probability of the range_lower_limit value
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: math:INVALID_ARGUMENT if any probability is not between 0 and 1
math:INVALID_ARGUMENT if the sum of probabilities is not equal to 1
math:INVALID_ARGUMENT if x_range and prob_range do not have the same number of values

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:prob
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function math:prob($x_range as double+, $prob_range as double+, $range_lower_limit as double) as double

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Function for SLOPE function.
It computes the formula:
sum((x - average_x)(y - average_y))
where average_x and average_y are computed with AVERAGE function.
Borrowed from excel module.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $x_numbers The sequence of x numbers.
$x_average The precomputed AVERAGE over the x_numbers.
$y_numbers The sequence of y numbers.
$y_average The precomputed AVERAGE over the y_numbers.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: The formula result, as numeric type.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: math:INVALID_INPUT if there are different numbers of x's and y's.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:sum-x-y-deviations
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare %private function math:sum-x-y-deviations($x_numbers as double*, $x_average as double, $y_numbers as double*, $y_average as double) as double

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Returns the slope of the linear regression line through data points in known_y's and known_x's.
The slope is the vertical distance divided by the horizontal distance between any two points on the line, which is the rate of change along the regression line. It computes the formula:
sum((x - average_x)(y - average_y)) / sum((x - average_x)^2)
where average_x and average_y are computed with AVERAGE function.
Borrowed from excel module.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $known_y the sequence of y numbers. The sequence can be of any length, from 1 up.
$known_x the sequence of x numbers. The sequence can be of any length, from 1 up.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: The slope value, as numeric type
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: math:INVALID_INPUT if there are different numbers of x's and y's or if the sequence is empty
math:DIVIDE_BY_0 if all x's are equal

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:slope
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function math:slope($known_y as double+, $known_x as double+) as double

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Returns a normalized value from a distribution characterized by mean and standard_dev.
The formula is (x - mean) / standard_dev .
Borrowed from excel module.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $x is the value you want to normalize
$mean is the arithmetic mean of the distribution.
$standard_dev is the standard deviation of the distribution.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: The normalized x, as numeric type
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: math:INVALID_ARGUMENT if standard_dev is a value smaller than zero or equal

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:standardize
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function math:standardize($x as double, $mean as double, $standard_dev as double) as double

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Estimates standard deviation based on a sample.
The standard deviation is a measure of how widely values are dispersed from the average value (the mean). It is computed with formula: sqrt( sum((x-average_x)^2) / (n-1) ) = sqrt ( VAR(numbers) )
Borrowed from excel module.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $numbers the sequence of numbers The sequence can be of any length, from 1 up.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: the standard deviation, as numeric type

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:stdev
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function math:stdev($numbers as double+) as double

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Estimates standard deviation based on a sample.
The standard deviation is a measure of how widely values are dispersed from the average value (the mean). It is computed with formula: sqrt( sum((x-average_x)^2) / (n-1) ) = sqrt ( VARA(numbers) )
Borrowed from excel module.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $numbers the sequence of numbers. The sequence can be of any length, from 1 up.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: the standard deviation, as numeric type

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:stdeva
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function math:stdeva($numbers as double+) as double

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Calculates standard deviation based on the entire population given as arguments.
The standard deviation is a measure of how widely values are dispersed from the average value (the mean). It is computed with formula: sqrt( sum((x-average_x)^2) / n ) = sqrt ( VARP(numbers) )
Borrowed from excel module.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $numbers the sequence of numbers or values castable to numeric The sequence can be of any length, from 1 up.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: the standard deviation, as numeric type

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:stdevp
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function math:stdevp($numbers as double+) as double

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Calculates standard deviation based on the entire population given as arguments.
The standard deviation is a measure of how widely values are dispersed from the average value (the mean). It is computed with formula: sqrt( sum((x-average_x)^2) / n ) = sqrt ( VARPA(numbers) )
Borrowed from excel module.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $numbers the sequence of numbers or values castable to numeric The sequence can be of any length, from 1 up.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: the standard deviation, as numeric type

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:stdevpa
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function math:stdevpa($numbers as double+) as double

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Returns a subtotal in a sequence of numbers.
The function applied is given by $function_num.
Borrowed from excel module.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $function_num defines the function to be applied on sequence values. The possible values are: 1 or 101 AVERAGE 2 or 102 COUNT 3 or 103 COUNTA 4 or 104 MAX 5 or 105 MIN 6 or 106 PRODUCT 7 or 107 STDEV 8 or 108 STDEVP 9 or 109 SUM 10 or 110 VAR 11 or 111 VARP In this implementation there is no difference between x and 10x.
$numbers the sequence of numbers. The sequence can be of any length.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: The function result, as numeric type
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: * depends on the function called
math:INVALID_ARGUMENT if $function_num is not a value between 1 .. 11 or 101 .. 111

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:subtotal
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function math:subtotal($function_num as integer, $numbers as double*) as double
